alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 2:21PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Laramie County through 300 PM MDT... At 220 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Crystal Lake Campground, or 17 miles west of Cheyenne, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, Crystal Lake Reservoir, Federal, Crystal Lake Campground, Warren AFB and Ranchettes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 14 and 17. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 339 and 356. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
